suncertify.panels
Interface FieldInputComponent

All Known Implementing Classes:
BooleanEntryField, GenericEntryField, StringEntryField
public interface FieldInputComponent

Identifies a GUI component for entering a database field value for searching.

Method Summary
 void addListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
          Add the given PropertyChangeListener.
 FieldInputComponent createClone()
          Creates a clone of this input component.
 java.awt.Component getComponent()
          Get the Component for this widget so we can display it.
 Criterion getCriterion()
          Get the Criterion for this field based on the value entered by the user.
 void removeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
          Remove the given PropertyChangeListener.
 void searchPerformed()
          This method is called when search has just been performed.
 

Method Detail

createClone

FieldInputComponent createClone()
Creates a clone of this input component. Note that the clone's history list will be empty.

Returns:
A clone of this component

getComponent

java.awt.Component getComponent()
Get the Component for this widget so we can display it. This could be a JComboBox, JCheckBox etc. Complicated input components could return a JPanel containing several sub-components.

Returns:
the Component to display

getCriterion

Criterion getCriterion()
Get the Criterion for this field based on the value entered by the user.

Returns:
a Criterion object encapsulating the search criterion for this field.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user's input could not be parsed

searchPerformed

void searchPerformed()
This method is called when search has just been performed. It can add the current item to the input component's history, for example.

addListener

void addListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
Add the given PropertyChangeListener.

Parameters:
listener - the PropertyChangeListener to add

removeListener

void removeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
Remove the given PropertyChangeListener.

Parameters:
listener - an existing PropertyChangeListener to remove
